result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 9:58 AM Defendant Christopher E Hoyt in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Michael Hughes appeared by video for Christopher E Hoyt.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. State - here for a PH, believe it is being waived. Hoyt and Hughes agree, has not filed a waiver but did go thru it with the defendant. Court does verbal waiver of PH form, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed an Information. Hughes and Hoyt have Information, waives reading, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG plea to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for JT, keep making court appointed attorney fees.

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher E Hoyt in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, reminds defendant of his payment for court appointed attorney fees (given copy in Court), sets for PH on 8/5/22 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of THC even if legal in the jurisdiction that the defendant may be in.

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher E Hoyt in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court asks defendant the status of him retaining counsel. Hoyt responds, has tried to get counsel and for various reasons - still does not have one, was going to ask for court appointed attorney or more time to retain counsel. Court provides with court appointed attorney form, continues bond, sets for AIA on 6/22/22 at 10:30 AM, return court appointed attorney form. Defendant asks Court to modify bond deleting the IID requirement for stated reasons. Court will delete that condition, still no consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of THC even if legal in the jurisdiction that the defendant may be in.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.

No consumption of alcohol. No operation of motor vehicle without IID. Upon request from law enforcement, defendant must provide evidentiary sample of breath and/or blood to determine presence of alcohol or drugs.

10:15 AM Defendant Christopher E Hoyt appears by video, in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hoyt has not received a copy of complaint. Court reads charge and penalty. Hoyt understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Hoyt has contacted SPD is not qualified, has reached out to an attorney. Court will adjourn to allow time for him to speak with his attorney. State asks for bond to remain. Court will continue bond. Hoyt makes bond argument, asks for $500 cash bond. Court questions employment. Hoyt responds. State no objection to $2000 cash bond with same conditions. Hoyt questions condition of IID. State indicates bond was set by Judge. Court will reduce bond to $1500 cash bond, with same conditions that were set by the Judge.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher E Hoyt

No consumption of alcohol. No operating vehicle without ignition interlock. Upon request provide evidentiary sample of blood or breath
